article.headline: California 83, Northern Colorado 59
article.story: BERKELEY, Calif. (AP) -- DeVon Hardin had a difficult time last season playing well on a consistent basis. Leon Powe's latest absence has given him no choice. Hardin scored a career-high 21 points and grabbed 10 rebounds for his second straight double-double, and California defeated winless Northern Colorado 83-59 on Friday night in the opening round of the Golden Bear Classic. "I thought DeVon responded very well," said coach Ben Braun, who celebrated his 52nd birthday. "He had a great energy game for us. He responded to the challenge." Cal advanced to play Saturday in the championship game against Northeastern, a 102-81 winner over Cal State Northridge in Friday's first game. The Golden Bears won their tournament last season and have captured the title in eight of the last 12 years, including seven of nine during Braun's tenure. Ayinde Ubaka scored 16 points, one shy of his career high, and passed for five assists to help Cal lead by as many as 39. Hardin had another big game in Powe's absence, following his career-high 14 points against Long Beach State on Monday by making 6-of-8 field goals and going 9-for-13 from the free throw line. Hardin made an impressive block on a shot by Kirk Archibeque with 9:30 left, and a frustrated Archibeque immediately pushed Hardin down with his shoulder into the protective padding beneath the basket for a flagrant foul. Hardin said he now has an "incredible focus." In Cal's season-opening 67-65 loss at Eastern Michigan, he missed a putback at the buzzer that would have sent the game to overtime. "I had up and down games all last season," Hardin said. "Strength wise and mentally, I'm focused. The basketball court is fun to me. It's my outlet." Richard Midgley returned to Cal's lineup after missing Monday's game against Long Beach State with a shoulder stinger, finishing with 11 points and five rebounds. The Golden Bears, still without injured forward Leon Powe, jumped out to a 19-0 lead in the first 4½ minutes before Darren Jeffries scored for Northern Colorado at 15:02. Sean Taibi scored 15 points and Archibeque 14 for Northern Colorado (0-5), which scored two more points than its season low in the first meeting between the schools. UNC is in its third season playing Division I. "It hurts right now, but it's part of our evolution and part of where we're trying to go to be a player in Division I," said Northern Colorado coach Craig Rasmuson, who coached with Braun at Eastern Michigan. "It's a crucial night for us tomorrow night. We're almost at a crossroads." Cal (2-1) shot 46.8 percent and also got 13 points and five rebounds from Theo Robertson. Rod Benson, the Golden Bears' leading scorer and rebounder last season, spent the second half on the bench in street clothes after aggravating a stress fracture in his heel that caused him to miss the season opener. He played only four minutes. Cal made its first seven field-goal attempts and 12 of its first 21, and forced Northern Colorado into 14 first-half turnovers on the way to a 43-20 lead at the break. Powe, the conference freshman of the year and rebounding champion two years ago, missed all of last season recovering from knee surgery and has not played this season because of a stress fracture in his right foot. Powe underwent an MRI exam Friday and Braun expects he will make his season debut Wednesday night at home against San Jose State. Powe received medical clearance Friday to return, and he practiced Friday. Braun is eager to see his squad at full strength soon. "We have one of the biggest and probably one of the best front lines in the Pac-10, if not the country," Hardin said. Northern Colorado has lost eight straight dating to a win over Colorado College on Feb. 22.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
